front.title: The v5 Approach for the Transition from IPv4 to IPv6

abstract.t: This document introduces a new approach intended to lead to a simple roadmap from the IPv4 Internet to a pure IPv6 one. With it, applications, protocol stacks and customer edge devices need only one standardized intermediate v5 version between v4 and v6. Internet service providers upgrade their v4 service to two intermediate services: one with a v4 address and a v6 prefix, and one with only a v6 prefix but with access to transition tools within the network. Provision is also made for a standardized upgrade of 3GPP networks.
